bibdata.title: Review if specific ids will be included in the 'Recently added'

comments.body:
@tventimi 
id: 99125399762106421 has both 876 and 950. The indexed record will take the value from the 876 $d. It is in the catalog and it appears in the Recently added using the timestamp from 876$d.
```
<datafield tag="876" ind1=" " ind2=" ">
      <subfield code="0">22902606500006421</subfield>
      <subfield code="a">23902606490006421</subfield>
      <subfield code="j">0</subfield>
      <subfield code="d">2021-10-06 16:02:07</subfield>
</datafield>
```

id: 99120786123506421 has both 876 and 950. The indexed record will take the value from the 876 $d. It is in the catalog and it appears in the Recently added using the timestamp from 876$d.
```
<datafield tag="876" ind1=" " ind2=" ">
      <subfield code="0">22669968970006421</subfield>
      <subfield code="a">23669968960006421</subfield>
      <subfield code="j">1</subfield>
      <subfield code="d">2021-07-13 05:51:27</subfield>
      <subfield code="p">32101109581031</subfield>
      <subfield code="t">0</subfield>
</datafield>
```

id: 99120786123506421 has both 876 and 950. The indexed record will take the value from the 876 $d. It is in the catalog and it appears in the Recently added using the timestamp from 876$d.
```
<datafield tag="876" ind1=" " ind2=" ">
      <subfield code="0">22669870600006421</subfield>
      <subfield code="a">23669870590006421</subfield>
      <subfield code="j">1</subfield>
      <subfield code="d">2021-07-13 05:51:10</subfield>
      <subfield code="p">32101109580793</subfield>
      <subfield code="t">0</subfield>
</datafield>
```

more discussion on this: https://pulibrary.slack.com/archives/CA891BNR0/p1634048664400300?thread_ts=1633635341.381400&cid=CA891BNR0
https://pulibrary.slack.com/archives/CA891BNR0/p1633635352381600
https://pulibrary.slack.com/archives/CA891BNR0/p1633635341381400

dpul.title: Fix fonts on exhibit pages
Fix display of headers in show page.
Show page title header should be styled
Get rid of dead space at the bottom of pages
aligns rtl text properly in masthead
Aligns RTL to right in masthead
Migrate link_to_facet field to link_to_search for compatibility with Blacklight 7
Metadata values should render as a list
CSV-migrated item-level metadata for scanned resources from Historic Postcards Finding Aid Collection is not displaying in DPUL Collection.

comments.body: @kelea99 can you give an example of a record in DPUL that does what you expect and one that doesn't do what you expect? Which field did you expect to see? Is this only about the edit view or also the show view?

@hackartisan  I want to see all metadata that is in figgy for this collection pushed to DPUL, but it is unclear to me how items (that are not ephemera) map when the metadata that exists is not being pulled from the MARC/Components into figgy.  the collection is acting like it was ingested as a title only, if that makes sense?

What is this thing? It's like it's a SimpleResource that isn't marked as a change set. Example: https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/9edd6ba1-b555-4877-b67f-6b9e1596f967

I'm assuming someone ingested this manually as a ScannedResource and set metadata properties on the root?

[postcards.csv](https://github.com/pulibrary/dpul/files/7332006/postcards.csv)

```sh
BASEDIR=/mnt/diglibdata/pudl COLL=ae59ec0a-e462-4029-b09d-9d2d8100b8f6 CSV=/home/deploy/postcards/postcards.csv bundle exec rake csv:ingest_resources
```

comments.body: @tpendragon Which classes did we override? What were we using the new class names for?
@hackartisan It added "col-sm-1" to the document counter and "col-sm-11" to the document (fixing this same problem, effectively, but now Blacklight takes care of it.)

![Screen Shot 2021-10-12 at 11 30 15 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2806645/137009894-88fa8c7a-02e8-4282-b745-990eecf2e919.png)

comments.body: @kelea99 Do you know of this in use in production? I tried it in prod and the embed does show up, but very small. If it's not in use we should deprioritize this ticket.

dpul.title: Fix slideshow component
Widget - Item Slideshow: How is this supposed to look if it functions properly?
Fix slideshow.
Adjust quote.

comments.body: What is this supposed to look like? This is what I get, which has different placement of the quotes than the screenshot from @tpendragon:
Oh geez. I wonder if it's a browser thing? What browser, @sdellis ?

@tpendragon chrome and firefox were what I looked at it in. If I set `.quote::before` to `top: -75px;` it looks like yours. I put my quote widget on a feature page, but it looks like your example is on the collection home page? Perhaps that could be affecting the layout?
@sdellis Yours is what mine looks like when I'm not on this branch. I wonder if your styles just had to update?
